message.content:
cs.NI, cs.IT, cs.SY, cs.MM, cs.CR

This paper deals with optimization algorithms for wireless networks, specifically for the fifth generation (5G) mobile networks. The paper discusses technical solutions such as dynamic asymmetric uplink/downlink resource allocation and elastic association of cells to users with decoupled uplink and downlink (DeUD) access. These topics are closely related to the field of network infrastructure (NI) and information theory (IT). The paper also proposes a three-step optimization algorithm to jointly optimize the uplink and downlink bandwidth allocation and power control, which involves system-level control and optimization (SY). Additionally, the paper presents numerical results illustrating the theoretical findings for network simulator in a real-world setting, which involves multimedia (MM) and cryptography (CR) aspects.
